instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Stuck in Apple Hardware Test
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b water damage it was dead i fixed the one wire circuit but now computer is super slow im trying to run Apple Hardware Test takes forever to start the test after i start the test goes one bar the first step and it doesn't move from there also when i move the mouse is lagging. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Stuck in Apple Hardware Test
threads.message: Run the EFI version of ASD. My first bet would be on the <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> area voltage sensor.
